name: Home Friendly Insurance Company v. Lichliter et al. (Pa. Labor Relations Board, Appellant)

judges: Before Schaffer, C. J.; Maxey, Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson and Parker, JJ.
parties: Home Friendly Insurance Company v. Lichliter et al. (Pa. Labor Relations Board, Appellant).

opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mr. Chief Justice Schaffer,
For the reasons stated in the preceding case, the appeal is dismissed.
opinions.author: Mr. Chief Justice Schaffer,

attorneys: J. Charles Short, with him M. Louise Rutherford, Deputy Attorney General, and Claude T. Reno, Attorney General, for appellant.
Ralph S. Croshey, of Croslcey & Edwards, and Theodore L. Reimel, for appellee.
Joseph A. Padway, Herbert S. Thatcher and James A. Glenn, for amicus curias.
casebody.head_matter:
Home Friendly Insurance Company v. Lichliter et al. (Pa. Labor Relations Board, Appellant).
Argued January 26, 1942.
Before Schaffer, C. J.; Maxey, Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson and Parker, JJ.
J. Charles Short, with him M. Louise Rutherford, Deputy Attorney General, and Claude T. Reno, Attorney General, for appellant.
Ralph S. Croshey, of Croslcey & Edwards, and Theodore L. Reimel, for appellee.
Joseph A. Padway, Herbert S. Thatcher and James A. Glenn, for amicus curias.
March 23, 1942:
